column4: does anyone know why I can't ssh into my server with thsi new user (is it to do with the shell or group?)  externalaccess:x:1005:1006::/home/externalaccess:/bin/sh
Whats happening when you try?
I'm getting permission denied.  I have set the pwd twice with usermod -p pass externaluser
Does that user's home directory exist?
pico - probably not
adding now
still no dice, odd.
Can you add the -v argument to ssh and see if the error is coming out of ssh or that user's shell?
OK
it is saying: debug1: Authentications that can continue: publickey,password
Permission denied, please try again.
what is freaking me out
is i have created loads of accounts nad had no issues before
doing to try a basic pwd now
I just changed the pwd with: usermod -p testing externalaccess
Can you check /var/log/auth.log , perhaps theres something relevant logged there.
OK
Aug  5 13:29:29 localhost sshd[2557]: Failed password for externalaccess from 81    <- mostly that. So wtf
it was usermod -p that didnt' work. passwd externalaccess worked fine. Hmm.]
Can you change that user's password with passwd instead of usermod?  I'm looking through the usermod manpage and it looks like it expects an encrypted password there.
Yes, that :)
yeh, figured it'd want the pwd pre-encrypted
I'm sure I have been here before. Doh! Thanks for your help!
Sure.
